articles.author: Samuel Yang
articles.title: ASX to dip as global markets slide on US CPI outlook, Ukraine war and China lockdowns - ABC News
articles.description: Australian shares are expected to start the day lower after global equity markets fell, pulled lower by technology shares in Europe and on Wall Street.
articles.content:
Australian shares are expected to start the day lower after global equity markets fell, pulled lower by technology shares in Europe and on Wall Street.

articles.author: Wale Odunsi
articles.title: NPHCDA receives Italy’s 3m COVID-19 doses donated to Nigeria - Daily Post Nigeria
articles.description: The National Primary Health Care Development Agency (NPHCDA)on Monday in Abuja, Nigeria's capital, received over 3 million single-shot COVID-19 vaccines donated by Italy. More than 17 million doses were earlier sent by other European-Union member states. The …
articles.content:

articles.author: Joshua Lees
articles.title: Russian karting champion, 15, investigated by FIA for 'Nazi salute' on podium - The Mirror
articles.description: Artem Severiukhin, 15, appeared to display the Nazi salute - which he denies - when taking to the podium at the European Karting Championships after winning the 11-15 race.
articles.content: Russian karting champion Artem Severiukhin is being investigated by the FIA after appearing to display the Nazi salute after competing at the European Karting Championships. Severiukhin had won the 1… [+3009 chars]

articles.title: Austrian leader has 'open and tough' talks with Putin in Russia - Reuters
articles.description: Austrian Chancellor Karl Nehammer held "very direct, open and tough" talks with Russian President Vladimir Putin near Moscow on Monday, in Putin's first meeting with a European Union leader since the invasion of Ukraine started more than six weeks ago.
articles.content: VIENNA, April 11 (Reuters) - Austrian Chancellor Karl Nehammer held "very direct, open and tough" talks with Russian President Vladimir Putin near Moscow on Monday, in Putin's first meeting with a Eu… [+3173 chars]

articles.author: Rob Harris
articles.title: Cats, hoodies and the survival of civilisation: France’s clash of outsider candidates - Sydney Morning Herald
articles.description: Will anger over Emmanuel Macron’s arrogance persuade French voters to back the far-right’s Marine Le Pen over “Monsieur Europe”?
articles.content:
Le Pen and Putin were previously perceived as cosy. Macron leapt on that in recent days, and she was forced to denounce his actions.
The past six weeks have moved the dial on Europes foreign policy.… [+3254 chars]

articles.title: Battle looms in Ukraine's east, as Austrian leader to meet with Putin - BreakingNews.ie
articles.description: Austrian Chancellor Karl Nehammer (above) said he would meet with Putin on Monday in Moscow for the Russian leader's first face-to-face meeting with a European Union counterpart since Russia's invasion began on Feburary 24th.
